summary: 1.  Doctors change protective garments frequently because of excessive heat, which increases likelihood of infection.  Water-cooled garments weigh only about 1lb, but must be connected with a (battery operated) fridge for ice water.  Also useful for patients with hyperthermia.  We used wet sheets, fans and cold water enemas for postop craniotomies  (now treated with steroids). I suggested this weeks ago by 'phone with  Medecins sans Frontieres in Bordeaux, but they didn't think it necessary.
